title: Activity Theory and Instructional Design Integration Project

context.prior_knowledge: Core concepts in social studies, digital tool utilization skills, team project experience
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environments for solving social issues, utilizing online-offline collaborative tools.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the six components of activity theory (subject, object, tools, rules, community, division of labor) to actual instructional design.
Learners can analyze theoretical frameworks and develop integrated instructional designs for social problem-solving projects.
Learners collaboratively develop instructional design prototypes in blended environments and improve them through peer evaluation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
